sub_topic: The chaotic dynamics of the Chirikov-Taylor map
message_1:
What is the largest value of the parameter k in the Chirikov-Taylor map equation, x(n+1) = x(n) + y(n) - k*sin(2Ï€x(n)), for which the system has both regular and chaotic regions? 

Hint: The Chirikov-Taylor map exhibits an onset of chaotic dynamics at a critical value of the parameter k, known as the Chirikov parameter, which is approximately equal to 0.9716.
message_2: The largest value of the parameter k in the Chirikov-Taylor map equation for which the system has both regular and chaotic regions is approximately equal to the Chirikov parameter, which is 0.9716.
